<<<<<<< HEAD
The accomplish'd lady, or, Deserving gentlewoman being vindication of innocent and harmless females from the aspersions of malicious men : wherein are contained many eminent examples of the constancy, chastity, prudence, policy, valour, learning, &c. wherein they have not only equal'd but excell'd many of the contrary sex. Norris, James, fl. 1682-1684.
[6], 165, [1] p.
Printed for James Norris ..., London : 1684.
Attributed to James Norris by Wing (2nd ed.). Preface signed: J.N. Imperfect: cropped and with print show-through, and loss of text. Title page-p.3 from defective CH copy spliced at end. Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
=======

Norris, James, fl. 1682-1684.
[6], 165, [1] p.
Printed for James Norris ..., London : 1684.
